results.title: I'm positive that's sugar
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Intended for discussion use. This film to be used to introduce the new Primary Science course. Children are seen and heard as they classify and group various materials. Observations and “experiments” are carried out.

results.title: I'm no fool with fire
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket shows how humans have depended on fire through the ages and describes the rules of fire safety, how to extinguish a fire and the most effective ways of fire prevention.
results.description: Jiminy Cricket shows how humans have depended on fire through the ages and describes the rules of fire safety, how to extinguish a fire and the most effective ways of fire prevention.

results.title: I'm no fool in water
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket tells something of the history of swimming as a sport and goes on to describe the safety rules for swimming. Among these are the right and wrong places to swim, the chief water hazards, the need to wait two hours after eating and to swim in company.

results.title: I'm going to school today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Primary education in Australia. Discusses the changes in school environment and teaching methods. How well does the present education prepare a child to take his place in a fast changing modern world, where the emphasis is on adaptability?

results.title: I'm dependent, you're addicted
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Takes a look at the medical facts about the five main groups of abused drugs, examining some of the popular misconceptions about drug dependence. Shows how the illegal drug problem grows out of legal drug abuse. Uses laboratory animals to show effects. Touches upon unpublished American research into cannabis.

results.title: [ILO Webster]
results.creator_credit: Bert Kroon, John van der Heulen and Toonder Studios
results.brief_description: Unless we all work together the great problems of over population and massive unemployment has little chance of being overcome. This animated film discusses the problems and suggests possible ways of tackling them.

results.title: An Illustration of basic film editing principles
results.brief_description: Leon Barsha of the American Cinema Editors has taken a sequence from the motion picture “Baby Face Nelson” to illustrate film editing techniques. Actors Mickey Rooney, Sir Cedric Hardwicke and Carolyn Jones are shown from our angle as on a stage. Then Leon Barsha shows how the same scene was heightened in mood and drama by editing with use of inserts - two shots, close-ups and extreme close-ups.

results.title: I'll tell you where to put your airport
results.creator_credit: John Groom, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Program contrasts the modelling technique used in planning the new Mexico City Airpors with that used by the Roskill Commission for the siting of the third London Airport. Part 5 of Technology, a third level course. Systems modelling series.

results.title: I'll go again
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Michael McKennirey, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: I’ll Go Again is a film about four athletes and a team that competed in the 1976 Montreal Olympics. They had trained courageously to be among those who would mount the podium to receive a medal. None did. Was it worth it? The film answers the question. (Awards: Budapest; Yorkton)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cowan, Michael McKennirey, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
